Summary: Orange ball of light travling north to south in Westfield IN. July 5th, 2009, 10:20 pm.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was the only one in the Target parking lot from about 10:10pm to 10:25pm, taking a few fireworks pictures. Just trying out my new Nikon. I was waiting to see if there were going to be anymore fireworks, and noticed an orange ball of light. It was moving in a straight line from north to south. It was almost right over me. At first I thought it might be a plane. But no noise, and no typical airplane lights...red, white, green. I got my camera and got out of the car, and took four pictures. And then got my film camera and took a couple more on film, which I haven't got developed yet. But the digital photos came out really good. I'll post them as soon as possible. My computer is running too slow to up-load right now. I watched it moving south untill I couldn't make it out anymore. The whole sighting lasted maybe 3-4 minutes. This is the 3rd actual sighting I've had in the last two years. I got two good photos last year on July 24th. You can definately tell that these are not planes or balloons, or helicopters, etc.
